attributes.action: Give Ireland back to the Irish
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Basically, Britain literally stole the North of Ireland, and they want it back. Yeh...The protestants who are living in Northern Ireland may not agree, but who is to say that they should have a say?
The fact that Northern Ireland became occupied by Britain in the first place is so unfair.
Think of this analogy
Ireland is a teddy bear (it could kinda look like one)
well...England stole its head....
Now years and years later people are saying that they should keep it that way because the majority of people living in the head want it to be kept that way (and when I say majority I mean only just over half of the people...But who cares...It wasn't fair that they took it in the first place.
Northern Ireland is geographically part of Southern Ireland anyway....
Some might say that Ireland is not financially strong enough to "look after itself" but why should the british care about that if they don't even care about the freedom of irish people in Northern Ireland? Also, why can't the british leave the financial problems to the irish to sort out after they've given Northern Ireland back?
Just give it back...

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
